intro: Randia micracantha, commonly known as the small-fruited randia, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
